definition[0]: to destroy, remove, or get rid of something completely
example[0]: Whole villages were wiped out by the floods.
example[1]: Nothing could wipe out his bitter memories of the past.
definition[1]: to make you feel extremely tired
example[2]: The heat had wiped us out.
definition[2]: to fall or hit an object when you are doing something
example[3]: Scott wiped out on his bike.
